revised_title: Properties of Neurons in Trigeminal Subnucleus Oralis Responding to Tooth-Pulp Stimulation in Cats
tldr: This study investigates the properties of neurons in the trigeminal subnucleus oralis that respond to tooth-pulp stimulation in cats. The researchers found that these neurons receive convergent input from the face and mouth and respond to different types of stimuli, including noxious stimulation. This suggests that the rostral trigeminal nuclei may be involved in transmitting nociceptive impulses from oral and peri-oral regions.
